content: Hi everyone, what are the next steps to contribution? I was looking for review on this PR.
It is unclear if this goes to mathlib. CC : @Eric Wieser who once formalised parts of the matrix cookbook
ahh okay, I was using this for my thesis xD
An independent repo is better for a thesis. It is a self-contained unit.
But of course upstreaming it is welcome
Fwiw, waiting times for reviews and merging can be very long. Even months long these days
You can see how long the review queue is here : https://leanprover-community.github.io/queueboard/review_dashboard.html

I requested a copilot review. I have found it useful for ironing out formatting and linting issues that the standard linters won't catch. You don't have to address any nonsensical comments from it. But it should give you a good review

Oh awesome

Hey, beyond this PR, I was looking to make more sustained contributions to matlib. Are there any areas that are undersupported or where help is most needed right now?
Well what are your interests? There are many projects that need help. I think graph theory and perhaps probability and complex analysis are the ones where even the undergrad stuff aren't complete
